intro: Adyseton bidentatum, commonly known as the two-toothed lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Pertusariaceae. It is characterized by its crustose thallus, which forms a tight, adherent layer on rock surfaces. The lichen's morphology includes distinct, branched lobes with a granular texture. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often on limestone or silicate substrates. Its chemical composition includes various secondary metabolites that contribute to its ecological interactions and resistance to environmental stressors.
